fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: When responding to this question, we would like to you think about a typical person employed by the public sector, excluding the military. If you think there are large discrepancies between branches of the public sector, between the national/federal and subnational/state level, or between the core bureaucracy and employees working with public service delivery, please try to average them out before stating your response.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: How routinely do public sector employees grant favors in exchange for bribes, kickbacks, or other material inducements?

fxInfo_responses.value: Extremely common. Most public sector employees are systematically involved in petty but corrupt exchanges almost all the time.
Common. Such petty but corrupt exchanges occur regularly involving a majority of public employees.
Sometimes. About half or less than half of public sector employees engage in such exchanges for petty gains at times.
Scattered. A small minority of public sector employees engage in petty corruption from time to time.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2excrptps, *_osp, *_ord
